io::​reader_config
sp_base_object
io::​ .​reader_config

Base reader configuration object class.

Variables
m_file_handle
int m_file_handle

A handle to the file, when no file is open, it is set to 0 by default.

Method <is_open()> may be used to check if a file is currently open.

m_file_path
string m_file_path

The path to the file IO.

m_file_mode
string m_file_mode

The mode in which the file should be opened, since this is a reader, it is either "r" for normal reading or "rb" for reading binary data.

io::​file_reader
sp_base_object
io::​ .​file_reader

Base file reader class.

Types
Variables
m_buff
byte m_buffer[]

When reading the entire file instead of parsing line by line, it will be loaded onto this variable.

m_lines
string m_lines[$]

Any previously read lines can be accessed through this field.

m_cfg
reader_config m_cfg

Reader configuration object.

IO Operations
eof
virtual function int eof()

Returns the result from $feof system task on the current file handle.

If no file handle is currently open, returns -1.

open
virtual function void open()

Attempts to open the given ~_filepath~ for reading and sets a handle to the file internally upon success for further operations and processing.

Upon failure, it will report a fatal and exit.

Any previous open file handles will be automatically closed by the reader.

close
virtual function void close()

Closes the current I/O stream.

If no stream is active, the method silently returns

read
virtual function void read()

Read the entire file into the reader's buffer.

read_line
virtual function void read_line()

Read a line of input and return it.

If ~_lineno~ is set to the default, the reader will attempt to read the next available line of input.

If ~_lineno~ is specified, the reader will attempt to read the specified line.

Both when specified, and when left unspecified, a valid read would return the string buffer, and an invalid string would return null.

read_lines
virtual function void read_lines()

Read all lines into the queue until reaching eof or an error occurs, whichever happens first.

IO Configuration
cfg
virtual function reader_config cfg()

Get the reader's configuration object instance.

set_cfg
virtual function void set_cfg(
reader_config 
_cfg
)

Set _cfg as the reader's configuration object instance.

file_path
virtual function string file_path()

Get the currently set file path.

set_file_path
virtual function void set_file_path(
string 
_path
)

Set ~_path~ as the reader's file path.

file_mode
virtual function string file_mode()

Get the currently set file mode.

set_file_mode
virtual function void set_file_mode(
string 
_mode
 = 
"r"
)

Set ~_mode~ as the reader's file open mode.

file_handle
virtual function int file_handle()

Get the handle to the file.

When no file is currently open, it returns 0.

IO Data
line
virtual function string line(
int 
_index
 = 
-1
)

Returns the line from the read lines queue at the specified ~_index~.

If the index is left with its default value, returns the last line that was read by the reader instance.

If ~_index~ is invalid, returns null.

lines
virtual function string_queue lines()

Returned all previously read lines that are still available under m_lines queue.

buffer
virtual function bytearray_t buffer()

Returns the byte array buffer.

This buffer is used when reading an entire stream via read().

When reading line by line via read_line(), the ~line~ and/or ~lines~ methods should be used instead.

pop_line
virtual function string pop_line(
int 
_index
 = 
-1
)

Same as method line(), but also pops the line from the fifo before returning it.

num_lines
virtual function int num_lines()

Returns the current size of the lines() queue.

is_open
virtual function bit is_open()

Returns 1 if an I/O stream is currently open for reading, or 0 otherwise.

has_error
virtual function bit has_error()

Returns 1 if an error occured during the last reading operation or 0 otherwise.

Printing Data
print_line
virtual function void print_line(
int 
_index
 = 
-1
)

Prints a single line from the queue at the specified index to the standard output.

print_lines
virtual function void print_lines()

Prints all lines in the queue to the standard output.

last_error_code

Returns the latest returned error code, if any.

If no error code was ever returned, returns 0.

error_string
virtual function string error_string()

Returns the latest error string retrieved from <$ferror()>, or an empty string if no error previously occured.
